comment.author: 25053608@N03
comment._content: A memoria americana é posta sempre em estado de valorizar a memoria

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Andrew James "Andy" Coakley (November 20, 1882 - September 27, 1963) born in Providence, Rhode Island was a pitcher for the Philadelphia Athletics (1902-06), Cincinnati Reds (1907-1908), Chicago Cubs (1908-09) and New York Highlanders (1911). en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Coakley

comment.author: 35687899@N00
comment._content: Perhaps taken at Columbia's old South Field (where the South Lawn and Butler Library are now)? That's where Columbia's athletic teams played before they started moving everything up to the northern tip of Manhattan in the mid-late 1920s. www.columbia.edu/acis/history/southfield.html www.columbia.edu/acis/history/gehrig.html

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Perhaps this marks his 1914 arrival as Columbia's pitching coach. See www.columbiaspectator.com/2008/04/25/baseball-program-hon... for a piece on the renaming of Columbia's baseball field in his honor.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A W. K. Watkins was in the class of 1914 at Columbia. See books.google.com/books?id=H8_mAAAAMAAJ&lpg=PA112&...
